website_summaries.verdict: A play-based book of educational activities that will give your toddler a headstart.
pros: Comprehensive list of topics ranges from shapes to fine motor skills to Spanish
Many are low-prep lessons that take just a minute to assemble
Digital download is included with purchase so parents can access color printouts multiple times
cons: One or two readers have complained that the holiday section is limited in scope

customer_reviews.title: well--if you do not get this book--you are really missing ...
customer_reviews.text: well--if you do not get this book--you are really missing out.mothers, grandmothers and great-grandmothers this is for you.. Such simple ideas --such as showing kids how germs spread...not going to tell--just get the book If you are a teacher of young children, this book is for you. so excited to share with my friends!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Book/Guide For Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This book/guide is the most amazing collection of ideas for you and your toddler to enjoy together. After buying several other toddler books and being disappointed we will be purchasing this for all of our friends with toddlers. Thanks again for putting this together for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Miltsch

customer_reviews.title: Nice but expensive.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice book, but it shouldn't be $18. It's not like it comes with crayons or any of the stuff that's needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Engaging, fun educational activities for little ones...well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: A book full of fun, engaging activities for little ones. Such a useful tool to teach kids about community helpers, seasons, shapes, and many other everyday topics. If you enjoy doing activities with your kids, this book is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: towens

customer_reviews.title: Helps organize your daily "lessons"
customer_reviews.text: Nice book! Many simple activities for a toddler, some need a little preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource with a variety of offered activities and supporting information and aids
customer_reviews.text: Book was purchased for further interacting with our toddler grandchild. We already have several activities from which to keep her amused and exercising, with some learning. The book consists of concise descriptions of activities that include lists of needed materials and tools for use by the adult or the toddler and any associated worksheets that can be reproduced for repeated use. So, a reader can skim for activities to make selections based on goals, simplicity of preparations and available time with which to engage. Favorites can be repeated without damaging the book. If you become a fan of this author, she has comparable resources from pre-kindergarten through first grade for reading and math activities.
customer_reviews.author: Karl D. Feintuch

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet engaging activities!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this book for ideas for my two year old son. This is a great resource and comes with online resources / online printables for many activities. The supplies needed for many activities are easy to acquire and do not require expensive trips to the craft or other stores. The activities are simple enough for parents or caregivers to coordinate and for toddlers to do, but engaging enough to entertain your toddler for hours! We love this book and definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good resource for activities for your little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome activity book
customer_reviews.text: I love this little book. I got this a little early for my just 2 year old. I think some of the activities would be better sooted for a little older toddler but thats okay I am just cherry picking activities that are better for his current development level. I plan on getting more of these books.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately added TWO of these to my cart so I really am disappointed. I thought I'd give one to a friend but I feel like it's not worth giving. For the activities, you needed too many materials. I was hoping more of it was based on easy to find items or the cut out templates in the back. There was one activity that said to let your toddler learn about germs by touching everything and seeing the glitter left behind. Definitely not something I would do! I am sad I just came on to return the books (I never return anything) and the window closed.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Good for home schoolers
customer_reviews.text: I thought this book might be too young for my 6 & 7 year old. But I looked at pages available on description page and saw several things that were applicable. I'm happy I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce H.

customer_reviews.title: Keep your toddler entertained
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of activities, not just by subject/holiday, but also ones that require little-to-no prep/supplies for when you need something simple. A must have for toddler moms, especially during self isolation. Only complaint is that it doesn't have an activity where your toddler makes you coffee (kidding) ...
customer_reviews.author: bott8961

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2.5 year old daughter. I stay home with my kids and before quarantine she did two days at daycare which I know she misses - she loves projects and activities. These are so quick and easy! She loves them and I do too. I didn’t like going on the internet and having all the ideas all over the place - screen shots and what not. This is great because it’s all organized in one place. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K6789

customer_reviews.title: Its in black and white.
customer_reviews.text: I've read through a few of the lessons, it is nice to have a guide. However, for the steep price, I would have expected the book to at least be in color. It's for toddlers to teach them about things like color... kind of disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Asoer

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource!
customer_reviews.text: Great resource! There are so many great and easy activities to keep my preschooler busy. So far all of the activities and crafts have been performed using items that I already have laying around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Charity B.

customer_reviews.title: It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves the activities in the “Ultimate Toddler Guide.” I feel great that they are educational, not just something to keep him busy. The printable link is helpful for multiple copies, like when my nephew is visiting. It’d be a great gift. I’ll definitely age-up to the kindergarten version, and save this one for when my 1 year old is older.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review until we had done quite a few activities. Our toddler (3 now, 2 when he for it) loves doing them. Easy to follow, lots of variety and most things require little prep or need any special buying
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Unique Here
customer_reviews.text: This book doesn't offer much in terms of unique ideas. The majority of these can easily be found via a quick Google search. Also, many of these ideas are a bit boring. The book is fine if you're looking for a printed resource, but if you're internet savvy you'll most likely be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Creepstar

customer_reviews.title: Not for Montessori
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed. I used search words such as Montessori, Toddler, Curriculum and this book was recommended. It had good reviews and I was looking for fresh ideas for my classroom. Unfortunately it didn't fit the Montessori philosophy (maybe 3 activities). Better fit for a day care or home school setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Fiorillo

customer_reviews.title: A bit too religious for me; otherwise, fun and helpful
customer_reviews.text: It IS full of activities that seem fun and simple for two year olds and up. However, there is also a very religious aura to the book, as evident in the Easter/Resurrection/all around Jesus-y emphasis in many of the activities. If you’re nonreligious or of a different faith, that might be a turn off. Otherwise, some pretty good activity ideas.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nget

customer_reviews.title: Quantity over quality
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say I’ve been that impressed with this book. There are a lot of ‘filler’ activities and games that will have already occurred to any remotely engaged parent. I would have preferred quality over quantity.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Great low prep. Activities.
customer_reviews.text: Love the book. I do wish it came in color instead of just black and white. I also wish it had a file to download the attached appendix. If you do not have a copier you will only be able to do each activity only once. Would make a great gift for a teacher.
customer_reviews.author: mary hill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. My 3 year old loves doing things from this book
customer_reviews.author: Chad Infanger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Awesome collection of activities to keep your little ones busy! Bought to keep my grandchildren busy. You won’t regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: MKL

customer_reviews.title: Not quite satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The pages of this book are all black and white and so it is quite boring for a toddler to keep his interest.
customer_reviews.author: Deve

customer_reviews.title: FILE UNDER TODDLER FUN
customer_reviews.text: This book is SUCH FUN. loaded with GREAT IDEAS for helping my grandson learn and it’s truly just what I needed to read. As a first time grandma, my toddler activity to-do list was short but this book helped give me loads of great ideas and things to play. I have already copied the “alphabet giraffe” and today I gave a plate of Cheerios and a pipe cleaner project awaiting my grandson to make his beautiful mommy a bracelet. Autumn the author sure can write a very special book and I am glad I have it !!!
customer_reviews.author: NANCY

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and educational activities
customer_reviews.text: Using this book with my two year granddaughter. The activities are simple but engaging and educational. Love being able to download the worksheets! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bushell

customer_reviews.title: Not horrible, but certainly not great
customer_reviews.text: While some of the activity ideas and materials are good, there are a fair amount that are very, very basic. Too basic for my 4 year old for sure, which is who I planned to use this book with. I also wish I knew before buying that this book included so many Christian/religious activities as we’re a secular homeschooling family. Not a good fit for a few reasons. I don’t know that I’d recommend this book to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Chelssie

customer_reviews.title: Nice ideas but need more for 2 year olds probably best for 3 year olds.
customer_reviews.text: Some of these seem too hard for a two-year-old. And I have to go out and buy a bunch of supplies to do this stuff. Other than that some of the activities look like they will be fun. I don't like that the activity pages are in black-and-white and I have to go to the library to print off some that are in color. But these are still great ideas.
customer_reviews.author: CBD

customer_reviews.title: Great ideas!
customer_reviews.text: I run a daycare and this book has been great about giving me activity ideas to do with my littles! My oldest kiddo will be 3 in April, so my kiddos aren't very old but this book is perfect for us!
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn

customer_reviews.title: Must have to keep toddler busy
customer_reviews.text: So many great ideas and I love that it list all the supplies you will need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great activities
customer_reviews.text: Fun activities. I didn’t find that the book is forcing Christian views. It has activities for all holidays. I would definitely recommend buying this book.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Cute book!! Great to do with kids before they start school. The product itself is worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Hunni

customer_reviews.title: Cool ideas....kind of complicated
customer_reviews.text: Very very cool fin ideas however....some thing require a lot of time & materials you have to go out & get & requires a lot of your time. While in lockdown I was hoping for something a lil more simple & they go do it themselves. But....very cool ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: A lot of detail and easy to
customer_reviews.text: In Can’t wait times use this with my 2 & 3 year old
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book is great
customer_reviews.text: Really easy activities to do with your kid, educational and fun! Getting our sitter to do a couple of activities a day with our little girl. Good job :)
customer_reviews.author: Randall Mask

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Is a good source for parents, it give you ideas about educational and recreational activities to do with your toddler, however, I consider is a little pricey for what it is. Also, it is all black and white, wish it has some color on it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This book is perfect for home learning! My son is only 2 and a half but he loves this book! Some of it is a little too hard for him but hes learning and loves this book!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Wish the pictures in te activity pages were black and white so that they can be colored in. Instead they are all grey ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Martha Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Religious product geared toward children without transparency
customer_reviews.text: Religious references should not be included in children’s educational products unless specifically stated. How dare you sneak that in to children’s minds without their parents being aware. Shameful and totally upsetting. I will not promote this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Many of the pages of the book were covered in ink and water stains.
customer_reviews.author: KWilson

customer_reviews.title: Great book, I needed it for work!  Glad for the ideas it has.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Needed it. Will use. Happy now. Was looking for it. Now it’s here, reading it and planning activities.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Grace Bazley

customer_reviews.title: My 3 y/o really enjoys this!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of options for amusing, educational and creative things to do with your preschool aged kiddo(s). My little one feels confident and engaged during these “lessons” - as she calls them which is so great, as a parent, to witness. Though it’s worth noting that there are holiday activities throughout and when it comes to winter they do only focus on Christmas. We are not churchgoing religious but do celebrate Christmas as a family gathering and love-filled celebration. I can see why those with other faith see it as single minded but propaganda is an inaccurate extreme term.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla AM C
